com.facebook.litho.sections.widget

Class RecyclerCollectionEventsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.litho.widget.RecyclerEventsController
      • com.facebook.litho.sections.widget.RecyclerCollectionEventsController

  • public class RecyclerCollectionEventsController
extends RecyclerEventsController
    An controller that can be passed as Prop to a RecyclerCollection component to trigger events from outside the component hierarchy.

        Sent the RecyclerCollection a request to refresh it's backing data.

      • requestRefresh

        public void requestRefresh(boolean showSpinner)
        Sent the RecyclerCollection a request to refresh it's backing data. If showSpinner is true, then refresh spinner is shown.
        Parameters:
        showSpinner -

      • requestScrollToNextPosition

        public void requestScrollToNextPosition(boolean animated)
        Send the RecyclerCollectionComponent a request to scroll the content to the next item in the binder.
        Parameters:
        animated - whether the scroll will happen with animation.

      • requestScrollToPreviousPosition

        public void requestScrollToPreviousPosition(boolean animated)
        Send the RecyclerCollectionComponent a request to scroll the content to the previous item in the binder.
        Parameters:
        animated - whether the scroll will happen with animation.

      • requestScrollToPositionWithSnap

        public void requestScrollToPositionWithSnap(int target)
        Send the RecyclerCollectionComponent a request to scroll the content to the given target position taking into account snapping behavior.

        For example, if the content is center snapped, then the RecyclerView will scroll contents until the target position is visible at the center (as opposed to the edge of RecyclerView which is the case when using RecyclerEventsController.requestScrollToPosition(int, boolean)).

      • requestScrollToPositionWithSnap

        public void requestScrollToPositionWithSnap(int target,
                                            boolean animated)
        Send the RecyclerCollectionComponent a request to scroll the content to the given target position taking into account snapping behavior. Can toggle if the scroll is animated

      • requestScrollToPositionWithSnap

        public void requestScrollToPositionWithSnap(int target,
                                            RecyclerView.SmoothScroller smoothScroller)
        Send the RecyclerCollectionComponent a request to scroll the content to the given target position taking into account provided snapping behavior. The provided smoothScroller is used to scroll to the target.

      • requestScrollBy

        public void requestScrollBy(int dx,
                            int dy)
        Send the RecyclerCollectionComponent a request to scroll the content by the given margins.

      • requestSmoothScrollBy

        public void requestSmoothScrollBy(int dx,
                                  int dy)
        Send the RecyclerCollectionComponent a request to scroll the content by the given margins, animate a scroll by the given amount of pixels along either axis.

      • setSnapMode

        public void setSnapMode(int snapMode)

      • updateFirstLastFullyVisibleItemPositions

      • manuallySetViewportChangedFromExternalScroll

        @Deprecated
public void manuallySetViewportChangedFromExternalScroll(int firstVisibleIndex,
                                                                     int lastVisibleIndex,
                                                                     int firstFullyVisibleIndex,
                                                                     int lastFullyVisibleIndex)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the viewport visibility of the items in the SectionTree held by this recycler manually.

        You almost definitely don't want to use this. Please talk to the Litho team if you think you need to!
